title: How to develop a content strategy for a website - Quora

response.answer_text: A Content Strategy is a structure that guides your content marketing from the beginning stages to post-publication. It should be repeatable, organized, and agile. Here are the 5 steps to creating an effective content strategy: 1. Conceptualize content: When generating content ideas focus on your audience, their needs and wants (i.e do some online research, write down FAQs etc)Your main goal is to enough gather ideas so you can create content for every stage of the buyer’s journey—awareness, consideration, and decision. 2. Plan your content - Content Calendar You want to have a clear plan while maintaining some flexibility. For example, when planning content creation over the span of a quarter, try to have at least two or three lead generation initiatives that you can organize by buyer’s journey stages.Always keep your goals in mind. Is the focus for this quarter increasing leads? Improving the conversion rate for your sales team? More blog traffic?From there, map out what content you need and when it needs to be live. This will give you a sense of the resources you’ll need to get it done. 3. Create your own workflow Your workflow is just the sequence of steps that takes an asset from ideation to publication. It clearly identifies who will do what.Because content creation normally involves multiple components, you’ll want to get as granular as possible with your steps. ( This will help you scale up your efforts in the future). Here’s an example for an ebook:OutlineWrite first draftEdit first draftWrite second draftComplete design and formattingApprove final draftPublishKeep in mind your workflow should be always adapting as your content evolves. 4. QA Process You need a reviewal system in place to make sure your content is accurate, well written, and aligned with your brand. Here are a few steps you can take to QA your content. Set clear expectations: The reviewer should know what they’re looking for: grammatical errors, fact-checking, story gaps, word choice, and more.Define Clear roles: Each person should know what they need to do. Writers should not be editors and vice versaUse a style guide: A style guide is that common thread all content reviewers can use so that their edits establish consistency across a diverse group of writers. 5. Organize and store content Once your content is complete, store it in a centralized location —like Google Drive or Dropbox or your own CMS.Organizing your content in a consistent way so you'll be able to easily repurpose & reuse it.Further Readings What Is the Buyer's Journey? In today’s fast-paced and competitive online world, it’s paramount for online businesses to come up with better and newer ways to attract more visitors to their websites, retain & convert those visitors and to improve their website’s page rankings. Content marketing is one tool which can help you achieve these objectives. It is not only cost-effective marketing strategy but also a very important arm of digital marketing. If you observe, you absorb it everywhere – social media, advertisements, announcements, emails, blogs, search engines and so on. It is an art of storytelling. Why it is Important? The points mentioned below are just the tip of the iceberg. Anyone can use content marketing to their advantage to: Give relevant information that your customers are seekingBuild a community of loyal leadsImprove SEO and hence Google rankingIncrease brand visibility and popularityPosition your business as an industry expert and leaderAnd hence add brand value to your product or serviceIdentifying your goals Identify what is your aim for developing a content marketing plan? Ask yourself why are you creating it? For whom is it? What will it give your business in return? Also, know what your customers are looking for? Answering these questions will make your marketing strategy all the stronger and relevant. Once you know what you actually want to achieve with the content, measuring your success against which metrics will become easy. Research With a strong content marketing plan comes a lot of research. Knowing your target audience (TA) is extremely important, as you will be strategizing, creating and marketing it according to the TA you choose.
